<description type="note">Preliminaries and introductory material omitted<lb/>The following plays have been taken from this source:</description>

Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.

Joseph Lord What travayl to man is Wrought Rest in Ã¾is werd be-hovyth hym non Octauyan oure Emperour sadly hath be-sought Oure trybute hym to bere ffolk must forth ichon It is cryed in every bourgh and cety be name I Ã¾at am a pore tymbre wryth born of Ã¾e blood of dauyd Ã¾e Emperorys comawndement I must holde with And ellys I were to blame. Now my wyff mary what sey ?e to this For sekyr nedys I must fforth wende On to Ã¾e cyte of bedleem ffer hens i-wys Ãus to labore I must my body bende. Maria Myn husbond and my spowse with ?ow wyl I wende A syght of Ã¾at cyte ffayn wolde I se If I myght of myn Alye ony Ã¾er ffynde It wolde be grett joye on to me. Joseph My Spowse ?e be with childe I fere ?ow to kary Ffor me semyth it were werkys wylde but ?ow to plese ryght ffayn wold I ?itt women ben ethe to greve whan Ã¾ei be with childe now latt us Fforth wende as ffast as we may and al-myghty god spede us in oure jurnay. Maria A my swete husbond wolde ?e telle to me What tre is ?on standynge vpon ?on hylle. Joseph Ffor sothe mary it is clepyd A chery tre In tyme of ?ere ?e myght ffede ?ow Ã¾eron ?our Ffylle. Maria Turne A-geyn husbond and beholde ?on tre how Ã¾at it blomyght now so swetly. Joseph Cum on Mary Ã¾at we worn At ?on Cyte or ellys we may be blamyd I telle ?ow lythly. Maria Now my spowse I pray ?ow to be-hold How Ã¾e cheryes growyn vpon ?on tre Ffor to haue Ã¾er-of ryght ffayn I wold and it plesyd ?ow to labore so mech for me. Joseph ?our desyre to ffulfylle I xal Assay sekyrly Ow to plucke ?ow of these cheries it is a werk wylde Ffor Ã¾e tre is so hy? it wol not be lyghtly Ã¾erfore lete hym pluk ?ow cheryes be-gatt ?ow with childe. Maria Now good lord I pray Ã¾e graunt me Ã¾is boun to haue of Ã¾ese cheries and it be ?our wylle now I thank it god Ã¾is tre bowyth to me down I may now gaderyn A-nowe and etyn my ffylle. joseph Ow I know weyl I haue offendyd my god in trinyte Spekyng to my spowse these vnkynde wurdys Ffor now I beleve wel it may non other be but Ã¾at my spowse beryght Ã¾e kyngys son of blys He help us now at oure nede of Ã¾e kynrede of jesse worthely were ?e bore Kyngys and patryarkys ?ow be-ffore all Ã¾ese wurthy of ?our kynred wore as clerkys in story rede. Maria Now gramercy husbond for ?our report in oure weys wysely late us forth wende Ã¾e fadyr all myghty he be oure comfort Ã¾e holy gost gloryous he be oure frende. Joseph Heyl wurchepful sere and good day A ceteceyn of Ã¾is cyte ?e seme to be of herborwe ffor spowse and me I ?ow pray Ffor trewly Ã¾is woman is fful were And fayn At reste sere wold she be We wolde ffulffylle Ã¾e byddynge of oure emperour Ffor to pay trybute As ryght is oure and to kepe oure self ffrom dolowre We are come to Ã¾is cyte. Ciues Sere ostage in Ã¾is town know I non Ã¾in Wyff and Ã¾ou in for to slepe this cete is be-sett with pepyl every won And ?ett Ã¾ei ly with-owte fful every strete. With-inne no wall man comyst Ã¾ou nowth Be Ã¾ou onys with-inne Ã¾e cyte gate on-ethys in Ã¾e strete A place may be sowth Ã¾er on to rest with-owte debate. Joseph Nay sere debate Ã¾at wyl I nowth all such thyngys passyn my powere but ?itt my care and all my thought is for Mary my derlynge dere. A Swete Wyff what xal we do wher xal we logge Ã¾is nyght on to Ã¾e ffadyr of heffne pray we so vs to kepe ffrom every wykkyd whyt. Ciues Good man O word I wyl Ã¾e sey If Ã¾ou wylt do by Ã¾e counsel of me ?ondyr is An hous of haras Ã¾at stant be Ã¾e wey Amonge Ã¾e bestys herboryd may ?e be. Maria Now Ã¾e fadyr of hefne he mut ?ow ?elde His sone in my wombe forsothe he is He kepe Ã¾e and Ã¾i good be fryth and ffelde go we hens husbond for now tyme it is. But herk now good husbond a new relacyon which in my self I know ryght well Cryst in me hath take in-carnacion Sone wele be borne Ã¾e trowth I fele. In Ã¾is pore logge my chawmere I take here for to A-byde Ã¾e blyssyd byrth of hym Ã¾at all Ã¾is werd dude make be-twyn myn sydys I fele he styrth. Joseph god be Ã¾in help spowse it swemyth me sore Ã¾us febyly loggyd and in so pore degre goddys sone amonge bestys to be bore his woundyr werkys ffulfyllyd must be. In An hous Ã¾at is desolat with-owty Any wall Ffyer nor wood non here is. Maria Joseph myn husbond a-bydyn here I xal ffor here wyl be born Ã¾e Kyngys sone of blys. Joseph Now jentyll wyff be of good myrth and if ?e wyl owght haue telle me what ?e thynk I xal not spare for schep nor derth now telle me ?our lust of mete and drynk. Maria Ffor mete and drynk lust I ryght nowth all-myghty god my fode xal be now Ã¾at I am in chawmere brought I hope ryght well my chylde to se Therfore husbond of ?our honeste A-voyd ?ow hens out of Ã¾is place And I a-lone with humylite here xal abyde goddys hy? grace. Joseph All redy wyff ?ow for to plese I wyl go hens out of ?our way and seke sum mydwyuys ?ow for to ese Whan Ã¾at ?e trauayle of childe Ã¾is day Ffare well trewe wyff and also clene may God be ?our comforte in trinyte. Maria to god in hevyn for ?ow I pray He ?ow preserve wher so ?e be. hic dum joseph est Absens parit Maria filium vnigenitum. Joseph Now god of whom comyth all releffe And as all grace in Ã¾e is grownde So saue my wyff from hurt and greffe tyl I sum mydwyuys for here haue fownde Travelynge women in care be bownde with grete throwys whan Ã¾ei do grone god helpe my wyff Ã¾at sche not swownde I am ful sory sche is a-lone. It is not conuenyent a man to be Ã¾er women gon in travalynge wher fore sum mydwyff fayn wold I se my wyff to helpe Ã¾at is so ?enge. zelomy Why makyst Ã¾ou man suche mornyng tell me sum dele of ?our gret mone. Joseph My wyf is now in gret longynge trauelyng of chylde and is a-lone Ffor godys loue Ã¾at sytt in trone as ?e myd-wyuys Ã¾at kan ?our good help my ?onge spowse in hast a-none I drede me sore of Ã¾at fayr food. Salome be of good chere and of glad mood we ij mydwyuys with Ã¾e wyll go Ã¾er was nevyr woman in such plyght stood but we were redy here help to do. My name is Salomee all men me knowe Ffor a mydwyff of wurthy fame Whan women travayl grace doth growe Ãer as I come I had nevyr shame. zelomye And I am zelomye men knowe my name We tweyn with the wyl go togedyr and help Ã¾i wyff fro hurt and grame Com forth joseph go we streyth thedyr. Joseph I thank ?ow damys ?e comforte my lyff streyte to my spowse walke we Ã¾e way In Ã¾is pore logge lyght mary my wyff hyre for to comforte gode frendys a-say. Salome We dare not entre Ã¾is logge in fay Ã¾er is Ã¾er-in so gret bryghtnes mone be nyght nor sunne be day Shone nevyr so clere in Ã¾er lyghtnesse. zelomye In to Ã¾is hous dare I not gon Ã¾e woundyrffull lyght doth me affray. Joseph than wyl my-self gon in Alon and chere my wyff if Ã¾at I may All heyl maydon and wyff I say how dost Ã¾ou fare telle me Ã¾i chere the for to comforte in gesyne Ã¾is day tweyn gode mydwyuis I haue brought here. The for to helpe Ã¾at art in harde bonde zelomye And salomee be com with me Ffor dowte of drede with-owte Ã¾ei do stond and dare not come in for lyght Ã¾at they se. Maria hic maria subridendo dicat Maria. The myght of Ã¾e godhede in his mageste Wyl not be hyd now at Ã¾is whyle the chylde Ã¾at is born wyl preve his modyr fre A very clene mayde and Ã¾erfore I smyle. Joseph Why do ?e lawghe wyff ?e be to blame I pray ?ow spowse do no more so In happ Ã¾e mydwyuys wyl take it to grame and at ?our nede helpe wele non do Iff ?e haue nede of mydwyuys lo per auenture thei wyl gon hens Ã¾erfor be sad and ?e may so And wynnyth all Ã¾e mydwyuis good diligens. Maria husbond I pray ?ow dysplese ?ow nowth Ã¾ow Ã¾at I lawghe and gret joye haue here is Ã¾e chylde Ã¾is werd hath wrought born now of me Ã¾at all thynge xal saue. Joseph I Aske ?ow grace for I dyde raue O gracyous childe I aske mercy As Ã¾ou art lord and I but knaue Ffor-?eue me now my gret foly. Alas mydwyuis what haue I seyd I pray ?ow com to us more nere Ffor here I fynde my wyff a mayd and in here Arme a chyld hath here bothe mayd and modyr sch is in ffere Ã¾at god wole haue may nevyr more fayle modyr on erth was nevyr non clere With-owth sche had in byrth travayle. zelomy In byrth trauayle muste sche nedys haue or ellys no chylde of here is born. Joseph I pray ?ow dame and ?e vowch-saue com se Ã¾e chylde my wyff be-forn. Salome Grete god be in Ã¾is place Swete systyr how fare ?e. Maria I thank Ã¾e fadyr of his hy? grace his owyn son and my chylde here ?e may se. zelomye All heyl mary and ryght good morn Who was mydwyfe of Ã¾is ffayr chyld. Maria he Ã¾at no thynge wyl haue for-lorn Sent me Ã¾is babe and I mayd mylde. zelomye With honde lete me now towch and fele yf ?e haue nede of medycyn I xal ?ow comforte and helpe ryght wele As other women yf ?e haue pyn. Maria Of Ã¾is fayr byrth Ã¾at here is myn Peyne nere grevynge fele I ryght non I am clene mayde and pure virgyn tast with ?our hand ?our-self a-lon hic palpat zelomye beatam mariam virginem dicens zelomy O myghtfull god haue mercy on me A merveyle Ã¾at nevyr was herd be-forn Here opynly I fele and se A fayr chylde of a maydon is born And nedyth no waschynge as other don Fful clene and pure for soth is he with-outyn spot or ony polucyon his modyr nott hurte of virgynite. Coom nere gode systyr Salome be-holde Ã¾e brestys of Ã¾is clene mayd Fful of fayr mylke how Ã¾at Ã¾ei be And hyre chylde clene as I fyrst sayd As other ben nowth fowle arayd but clene and pure bothe modyr and chylde Of Ã¾is matyr I am dysmayd to se them both thus vndefyled. Salome It is not trewe it may nevyr be Ã¾at bothe be clene I can not be-leve a mayde mylke haue never man dyde se ne woman bere chylde with-owte grett greve. I xal nevyr trowe it but I it preve With hand towchynge but I Assay in my conscience it may nevyr cleue Ã¾at sche hath chylde and is a may. Maria ?ow for to putt clene out of dowth towch with ?our hand and wele a-say Wysely ransake and trye Ã¾e trewthe owth Whethyr I be fowlyd or a clene may. hic tangit salomee marie et cum arescerit manus eius vlulando et quasi flendo dicit Salomee Alas Alas and Wele a-Waye Ffor my grett dowth and fals beleve myne hand is ded and drye as claye my fals vntrost hath wrought myscheve. Alas Ã¾e tyme Ã¾at I was born thus to offende A-?ens goddys myght myn handys power is now all lorn Styff as a stykke and may nowth plyght Ffor I dede tempte Ã¾is mayde so bryght And helde A-?ens here pure clennes In grett myscheff now am I pyght Alas alas ffor my lewdnes. O lord of myght Ã¾ou knowyst Ã¾e trowth Ã¾at I haue evyr had dred of Ã¾e on every power whyght evyr I haue rowthe and ?ove hem almes for loue of Ã¾e Bothe wyff and wedowe Ã¾at Askyght for the And frendles chylderyn Ã¾at haddyn grett nede I dude them cure and all for the and toke no rewarde of them nor mede. Now as a wrecch ffor fals be-leve Ã¾at I shewyd in temptynge Ã¾is mayde my hand is ded and doth me greve Alas Ã¾at evyr I here assayde. Angelus Woman Ã¾i sorwe to haue de-layde wurchep Ã¾at childe Ã¾at Ã¾er is born towch Ã¾e clothis Ã¾er he is layde ffor he xal saue all Ã¾at is lorn. Salomee O gloryous chylde and kynge of blysse I aske ?ow mercy for my trespace I knowlege my synne I demyd a-mys O blyssyd babe grawnt me sum grace Of ?ow mayde Also here in Ã¾is place I aske mercy knelynge on kne moste holy mayde grawnt me solace Sum wurde of comforte sey now to me. Maria As goddys Aungel to ?ow dede telle my chyld is medycyn ffor every sor towch his clothis be my cowncelle ?owre hand ful sone he wyl restor. hic salomee tangit fimbriam Christi dicens Salomee A now blyssyd be Ã¾is chylde euer more Ã¾e sone of god for sothe he is Hath helyd myn hand Ã¾at was for-lore thorwe ffals be-leve and demynge a-mys. In every place I xal telle Ã¾is Of a clene mayd Ã¾at god is born And in oure lyknes god now clad is Mankend to saue Ã¾at was for-lorn His modyr a mayde as sche was be-forn natt fowle polutyd as other women be but fayr and fresch as rose on thorn Lely wyte clene with pure virginyte. Of Ã¾is blyssyd babe my leve now do I take. and also of ?ow hy? modyr of blysse Of Ã¾is grett meracle more knowlege to make I xal go telle it in iche place i-wys. Maria Ffare wel good dame and god ?our wey wysse In all ?our jurnay god be ?our spede and of his hy? mercy Ã¾at lord so ?ow blysse Ã¾at ?e nevyr offende more in word thought nore dede. zelomy And I Also do take my leve here Of all Ã¾is blyssyd good company praynge ?our grace bothe fere and nere On us to spede ?our endles mercy. Joseph The blyssyng of Ã¾at lord Ã¾at is most myghty mote sprede on ?ow in every place of all ?our enmyes to haue Ã¾e victory God Ã¾at best may grawnt ?ow his grace.
